result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian A. Jerroll

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:04 am - 15CM120 & 15CM122 - Defendant Brian A. Jerroll appeared with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DE pleads NO CONTEST to 15CM122.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC in 15CM122 and on motion of DA dismisses and reads in 15CM120 for purposes of repayment of restitution and submission of apology.  Court imposes: 15CM122 - Sentence withheld - 9 months probation. Conditions: $243 court costs; $200 DNAAS; $37 SBDA; Apology in both cases; Eligible for expungement; NO CONTACT with Teresa Gehrmann. 15CM120 - DRI - $48.98 Rest + 10% surcharge; $37 SBDA.  Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:10 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with Theresa Gehrmann, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

15CM120 & 15CM122 - Defendant Brian A. Jerroll appeared with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. One bond for both cases.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence
